text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

DONNA NOVITSKY:
I'm Donna Novitsky.

LAURA MARINO: And
I'm Laura Marino.

DONNA NOVITSKY:
Between the two of us,

we've amassed decades
of experience.

And let's face it, we've had
our fair share of mishaps.

LAURA MARINO: So
that's the reason

we decided to create this
course very much based

on our experience over years
of being product leaders.

DONNA NOVITSKY: As your career
progresses up the product

management food chain and
you become a product leader,

you will find that the
strategy for your products

become the strategy
for the entire company.

And you need to be thinking
bigger than you've ever
thought before.

LAURA MARINO: In this course,
we will use real life examples

to show you how to tailor your
product strategy and leadership

style to perfectly fit your
product category, industry,
and company.

DONNA NOVITSKY:
So at every turn,

we've included practical
examples from our product

leadership experience in
companies of all types

and sizes, as well as
role play exercises that

will help you think through
how to apply these concepts
in your own daily work.

LAURA MARINO: These are
lessons that you're not

going to find in
a book, but that

will help you prepare
for this challenges

that you'll face as you
progress in your career.

MICHAEL LEPECH: So when it
comes to product strategy

and leadership, I
practice what I preach.

LAURA MARINO: We'll also be
joined by Stanford professor

Michael Lepech,
Stanford lecturer Pedram

Mokrian, and product
leader Todd Johnson, who

will each bring their unique
perspective to product strategy.

DONNA NOVITSKY: We hope
that this information

helps you get wherever it
is that you want to go.
